definition: to resemble nature itself/of the highest quality (idiom)
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: The uptown, nestling under the mountain and beside the sea is set in the natural environment.
sentences.chinese: 一个个依山傍海的住宅小区与自然环境浑然天成。

sentences.english: His innate artistic sense can be seen in each piece of work.
sentences.chinese: 在他每一件作品中，都可以看到他浑然天成的艺术感。

sentences.english: Its interior has fruity transition, all like nature itself.
sentences.chinese: 它的内部则有圆润的过渡，一切浑然天成。

definition: to blend into one another/to blend together well
charm or grace (in poetry or art)
to sculpt/to carve (jade)/ornate artwork/overly elaborate prose
supernaturally fine craft (idiom); the work of the Gods/uncanny workmanship/superlative craftsmanship
lit. moving clouds and flowing water (idiom)/fig. very natural and flowing style of calligraphy, writing, etc/natural and unforced
implicit charm in rhyme or sound/hinted appeal/interest
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
to have quite a lasting charm
